cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles southeast of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest along the north coast of Cuba, then turning northwest toward the Florida Keys and northward up the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Jupiter Inlet to Flagler/Volusia County Line; Storm Surge Watch from north of Sebastian Inlet to Ponce Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: No hurricane or tropical-storm warnings in effect north of Sebastian Inlet at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, including the east-central coast from Ponce Inlet southward past Jupiter Inlet
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (65-85%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; 52% chance of 50-kt winds; 29% chance of hurricane-force gusts as the large wind field envelops east-central Florida late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–6 ft possible along the open coast from Ponce Inlet south to Jupiter Inlet, including Port Canaveral, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 16 inches possible along the east-central Florida coast, producing flash-flood potential and operational disruptions.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, coastal erosion, and possible shoaling/siltation of the port channel from wave action.
